title: How to Make Moroccan Cookies or Biscuits

steps.headline: Wash and dry the orange, then finely grate the peel.
Roast the sesame seeds in a pan.
Let them cool, and rub in a vijzel.
steps.description: (A vijzel is another word for a mortar and pestle) You can also use an electric grinder if a vijzel is not available.

steps.headline: Roast the flour in the same pan until pale brown.
steps.description: Afterwards, transfer the flour into a bowl.

steps.headline: Mix the flour, powdered sugar, baking powder, orange zest, melted butter, oil, and the sesame seeds in a large bowl.
Slowly beat the eggs into the dry mixture.
Preheat the oven to 160º C (320º F) and grease a baking sheet.
Make little balls of dough and space evenly on baking sheet.
Scatter granulated sugar onto the cookies, and place into oven.
Cook the cookies for 15 minutes, then allow to cool.

text: Wash and dry the orange, then finely grate the peel.  Roast the sesame seeds in a pan.  Let them cool, and rub in a vijzel. (A vijzel is another word for a mortar and pestle) You can also use an electric grinder if a vijzel is not available. Roast the flour in the same pan until pale brown. Afterwards, transfer the flour into a bowl. Mix the flour, powdered sugar, baking powder, orange zest, melted butter, oil, and the sesame seeds in a large bowl.  Slowly beat the eggs into the dry mixture.  Preheat the oven to 160º C (320º F) and grease a baking sheet.  Make little balls of dough and space evenly on baking sheet.  Scatter granulated sugar onto the cookies, and place into oven.  Cook the cookies for 15 minutes, then allow to cool.
